remarks: Define the partial mapping operation.  A partial function from ` B ` to ` A ` is a function from a subset of ` B ` to ` A ` .  The set of all partial functions from ` B ` to ` A ` is written ` ( A ^pm B ) ` (see ~ pmvalg ).  A notation for this operation apparently does not appear in the literature.  We use ` ^pm ` to distinguish it from the less general set exponentiation operation ` ^m ` ( ~ df-map ) .  See ~ mapsspm for its relationship to set exponentiation.  (Contributed by NM, 15-Nov-2007.)
